title: Update is needed for country processing of Turkish spellings for Türkiye

labels.name: task 66
labels.description: Support, maintenance, bug fixes (deployments, bugs, troubleshooting for clients) - Q1 2023

body:
## Overview

The official spelling of Turkey has been updated by the Turkish Government to "Türkiye" (also, Turkiye without the umlaut is possible). These spellings are not currently included in our codebase and thus return a parsing error when a user's list uses Türkiye/Turkiye/TÜRKİYE/TURKİYE as the country name. [List # 2349](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2349) is an example of this occurrence. 

### Expected Behavior

When a list has any of the current English "Turkey/TURKEY" or Turkish spellings of the country "Türkiye/Turkiye/TÜRKİYE/TURKİYE" it should be accepted and processed as a reference for the country.  

### Actual Behavior

1) Lists with "Türkiye/Turkiye/TÜRKİYE/TURKİYE" in the country column are resulting in a parsing error. [List # 2349](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2349) is an example of this occurrence. "Turkey" also needs to continue being supported, in addition to the other variations. 

2) All instances of "Turkey" on the front end should also be changed to "Türkiye." 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Log-in to [OS hub admin dashboard](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard)
* navigate to the desired list. It has been rejected due to the parsing error. [rejected lists](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard/lists/?status=REJECTED)
* select [list](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2349)
* note parsing error
* download the [submitted file](https://opensupplyhub-production-files-eu-west-1.s3.amazonaws.com/OSHub_Data_Template_Excel_Dosyas%C4%B1n%C4%B1n_Kopyas%C4%B1.xlsx?AWSAccessKeyId=ASIATUDGELUHESVHMSJQ&Signature=JirQl8pTpw4OcO6vEIPUpv93f5s%3D&x-amz-security-token=IQoJb3JpZ2luX2VjEMD%2F%2F%2F%2F%2F%2F%2F%2F%2F%2FwEaCWV1LXdlc3QtMSJIMEYCIQDqmlkdYtAiv65LyPpdmHRUqykNUgj%2FxYlh9UAqG5s8tAIhAOjpMEs4GHjTg07QIi%2BAA5o4i6h75IguYO279fpsTSt7KpkECEkQBBoMMjQ5MzIyMjk4NjM4IgzeJcH2829EzHvxsIwq9gNNOxnYG9xxGlQzkltKbCiEOZ0tb8YcxAKXvVfgULflvUWU4J7kzOLqzF24NfFF8rYSMYSW6DzrahxPSMNtBC5cHRL%2Fy4o0ckEeD8Dt38YtlMPzDFXiOXwUkTq2NqezHCoJkyP5S3xfbRnDSwA0ryPQtcbH9WDaz9UuW5ZIlFq6UF1KL9NEIzy%2FC8wM%2FOlxdwSCr95FkZizE83ZmcbSQUcuqYzBQcFC2afFC5%2BuYoAQO5rE%2BHUitah1pFO1rP5IpxAdtsVHm7jkWLGrCiNTIQ4vqeNvmf1TpYV2hxGLaJS8Q0A71K0z5TRQ7CVcqlgOqci5rekQMEj9ndeyz7PaE8moYCNdKV70hayevgRYxyjs69UdCofZpgOnyda1Kq86hcuJAzWy6gItFQIcTOPj%2FB4KQGIQW%2BqHVwpdz44h31L2aXS3HNoSX1Quwb2CW9K3KxeAQjeobM24d359Y623rryQqYTKtpgUq0zPUYqgpxAJ%2BtArM%2Fp5zvhsxivxzDsXGW%2FY%2BN8Ss5M1kq9YpyLARV43LZoRbdne9YkgKlCn3TTPKsMc2bIMqby%2FUs1md7yaiH1KtXuxS7YwOyx1aPfC327NfLGCkWUJZd8rpc6YNNFGH9JFnoDM%2Bg2QDYc%2F%2BUq8KEeqQAsgHy0jahqH03kwELRlqE5Te2SGMNfKhJ8GOqUBuh6ggYkXh2A38F4g%2Fte8cQeZFHomt7isgQQzfEgo723Nrf6eg%2By4UmOrI9JM88KnGpzQRunziVd5It3y4rONA4e2AA0m28A3%2B3LDOoWDrq7ljjbcl1Cu4pCuYLc%2FlFIxUL8hdPdQ6iY7VvvT7kYtLsSFDa7mlr7625rZY7FZ6zkjF9GqTzRNb05EQLm77b4KELcPfFxgD3002%2FGb4ThtbrnW3WtZ&Expires=1675704575)

title: Embedded Map CSV/Excel Downloads
body:
There are two behaviors that we'd like to fix in Embedded Map downloads:

1. The order of the fields in the CSV/Excel download should match the order of the fields configured in Embedded Map settings. 
2. There should only be one line per facility in the download, showing the active data from the contributor for that facility. There should not be additional rows with inactive data points from that contributor. The idea is that a user can come and download the list of facilities from an embedded map and only see each facility entered once with all the datapoints the contributor submitted in that row. 

cc @mariel-oar @vrwOAR

title: List approval workflow status updates are needed. Rejected lists to become "inactive". Replaced lists to become "rejected".
body:
## Overview

In the new upload workflow, contributor lists are reviewed by OS Hub team. When [rejected](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2035), the list will stop progressing through the workflow and a rejection message is delivered to the contributor. Though rejected, the lists are maintaining their active status in the [list source dashboard](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/406807/change/?_changelist_filters=contributor__id__exact%3D194) and thus remain on the [front end as an available list](https://opensupplyhub.org/profile/195?q=Akh%20Eco%20Apparels%20Ltd) for said contributor. The list details (list name and description) are available, however, the [facilities and all corresponding facility data points](https://opensupplyhub.org/facilities/?contributors=194&lists=2035) are not available; as the list was rejected prior to geocoding and matching.

Also, as a part of the upload process, a user has historically had the option to replace a previously uploaded list. Lists uploaded to OS Hub that are replaced with a new upload are being made inactive. However, their status within the Django facility list details remains as “Pending”. Therefore the list remains visible within both the OS Hub Dashboard & the user’s dashboard as a pending list awaiting inputs from the OS Hub admin. 

### Expected Behavior

- When a list is rejected during the list approval process the list should also be made inactive in the list source dashboard.
- When a list uploaded to OS Hub is replaced by the user, the status should be updated to “inactive” and “rejected”. It is not necessary to send the rejected notification to the user for this use case, as they have already replaced the list with another upload for processing. 

### Actual Behavior

- Though rejected, the lists are maintaining their "active" status in the [list source dashboard](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/406807/change/?_changelist_filters=contributor__id__exact%3D194) and thus remain on the [front end as an available list](https://opensupplyhub.org/profile/195?q=Akh%20Eco%20Apparels%20Ltd) for said contributor.
- Replaced lists are retaining the "pending" status in the change facility list dashboard. Example, [Mammut Sports Group - Mammut Sports Group AG Supplier List 2022](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/facilitylist/2215/change/)

### Steps to Reproduce

Rejected List items:
- Log-in to [OS hub admin dashboard](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard)
- navigate to desired list from [rejected list](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard/lists/?status=REJECTED)
- select [list](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2035) & verify rejected status
- visit [Django admin](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/) 
- [Sources](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/) 
- search contributor ([Next PLC](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/?contributor__id__exact=194))
- select desired list ([Next Plc (NEXT Tier 1 and Tier 2 Factory List September 2022) (406807)](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/406807/change/?_changelist_filters=contributor__id__exact%3D194)) & verify active list status

Inactive Pending List items:
- Log-in to [OS hub admin dashboard](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard)
- navigate to desired list from [pending list](https://opensupplyhub.org/dashboard/lists/?rowsPerPage=100)
- select [list](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2215) & verify inactive status
- visit [Django admin](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/) 
- [Sources](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/) 
- search contributor - [Mammut](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/?contributor__id__exact=337)
- select desired list - [Mammut Sports Group (Mammut Sports Group AG Supplier List 2022) (468155)](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/source/468155/change/?_changelist_filters=contributor__id__exact%3D337) & verify inactive list status
- Verify pending status in [Django admin](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/facilitylist/)
- select desired list - [Mammut Sports Group (Mammut Sports Group AG Supplier List 2022) (468155)](https://opensupplyhub.org/admin/api/facilitylist/2215/change/)
- Review list status: PENDING
- Mac M1, Opera GX browser

### Demo

From staging, here is the view as a user with an upload & replacement:
- [Stitch Fix test](https://staging.opensupplyhub.org/lists/1857) was replaced by [replace test](https://staging.opensupplyhub.org/lists/1870)

### Additional context

**Rejection error**: Is occurring with all rejected lists, however, most have been manually updated to reflect accurate records on the platform's front-end. These are the rejected lists currently displaying the error:
- [Next Plc (NEXT Tier 1 and Tier 2 Factory List September 2022) (406807)](https://opensupplyhub.org/lists/2035)

**Replaced Lists**: Replaced lists that should be updated to a status of “rejected”:

title: Fix sidebar infinite loop

labels.name: task 63
labels.description: A set number of hours for issues that come up (bugs, copy updates, etc)

body:
## Overview

When there's an error in the sidebar, it attempts to catch the error and reload the sidebar. Assuming that the error isn't transient, this causes an infinite loop of error -> reload -> error -> reload -> etc., which results in the page freezing. 

### Expected Behavior

The error should be caught and handled. Errors should not cause the page to freeze.

### Actual Behavior

The page freezes. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Raise any error in the sidebar to replicate locally.

### Demo

https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenSupplyHub/items/141/?item_page=0&#traceback

### Additional context

Issue #2313 is about the same Rollbar error.

title: Fix embedded map freeze

labels.name: task 63
labels.description: A set number of hours for issues that come up (bugs, copy updates, etc)

body:
## Overview

In embedded maps, if embedExtendedFields is undefined, the line `<ShowOnly when={!embed || embedExtendedFields.length}>` throws an error. This error is caught by the sidebar error catcher, which attempts to reload the section, which the reloads infinitely, causing the page to freeze. 

### Expected Behavior

Show the extended fields explanatory text only when the site is not in embed or their are embed extended fields. The page should not break. 

### Actual Behavior

The page freezes.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Visit https://opensupplyhub.org/facilities?contributors=3756&embed=1

### Demo

https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenSupplyHub/items/141/?item_page=0&#traceback

### Additional Context

#2314 is a separate issue for the fact that the sidebar goes into an infinite loop when there's an error.

title: `window.matchMedia` is returning undefined in some cases

labels.name: Task 60
labels.description: Q4: Support, maintenance, bug fixes (deployments, bugs, troubleshooting for clients)

body:
## Overview

`window.matchMedia` is returning undefined in some cases, causing the error "TypeError: t.addEventListener is not a function. (In 't.addEventListener("change",e)', 't.addEventListener' is undefined)" when running `mediaQueryList.addEventListener('change', handleMediaChange);` in `Navbar.jsx`.

[matchMedia](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/matchMedia) has full browser support, so it's unclear why it's undefined sometimes. 

### Demo

[Rollbar](https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenSupplyHub/items/82/?item_page=0&#traceback)

title: Adjust Facility Match searches return an error - "An error prevented fetching that facility"
body:
## Overview

When searching for a facility in the dashboard from the Adjust Facility Matches page, some of the search is returning an error stating, "An error prevented fetching that facility". It is an intermittent occurrence, not all searches are returning this error.

### Expected Behavior

From the Adjust Facility Matches page of the dashboard you can enter an OS ID and then click SEARCH to load the facility in question. The match history will populate the page and the split, transfer, & promote actions are available for facilities that are eligible for any of those actions. Any matches that are ineligible for those actions (split, transfer, and/or promote) will remain visible, however they're greyed out and cannot be accessed.

### Actual Behavior

From the Adjust Facility Matches page of the dashboard you can enter an OS ID and click SEARCH, however, the search returns this error "An error prevented fetching that facility".

### Steps to Reproduce

- [Dashboard](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/dashboard)
- [Adjust Facility Matches](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/dashboard/adjustfacilitymatches)
- Enter OS ID IN2019083V232EY
- Click SEARCH
- Error returned 
- 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97313337/196602868-e4258573-08b7-42f5-a039-3327bf2b9019.png)

- OperaGX browser
- M1 MacBook Pro 

### Demo

Optional. Screenshots, gifs, `curl` examples, console errors, log files, etc.

### Additional context

Additional OS IDs that returned the same error:

- PK20212306XKW2S
- VN2019083YQJWWT

body:
# Draft

This is a draft issue, and it will need to clarify specs and formalize what
counts as "done" before work begins on it.

Check with the issue's creator before starting work on this issue.

## Overview

When visiting a facility page directly from the [URL](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/facilities/IN2021291RSQKNR) the map rendered on the facility page is the full global map 
![Screen Shot 2022-10-16 at 13 42 55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97313337/196050077-51620485-1c35-4eab-9536-0bd88470a4e6.png) However, when visiting the same facility from the search results on the home page, the pinned location map is rendered. 
![Screen Shot 2022-10-16 at 13 47 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97313337/196050245-a585cbf7-5882-43a3-acd4-7eb0ab3852cf.png)

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Direct facility page route:

1. [URL](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/facilities/IN2021291RSQKNR) 
2. Result - Global map displayed

Screen recording clip: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97313337/196050552-a9711bf8-5657-4caf-95fb-ae3f6edc6ea6.mov

Home page search route:

1. [OS Hub home page](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org)
3. [Search, Orient & India filter](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/facilities?q=orient&countries=IN)
4. Click [Facility](https://prd.fb84e0f7529f2737.openapparel.org/facilities/IN2021291RSQKNR?q=orient&countries=IN)
5. Result - Pin location map displayed

Screen recording clip: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97313337/196050598-d29f6830-4a57-4240-a277-f7e419a25d11.mov

### Describe the solution you'd like

When visiting the direct URL of the facility profile page, the pin location map should be rendered.

### Additional Context

Additional facilities with similar behavior:
- BD2019248HY8MDR
- IN2020053QN9B47
- IN2022063J25YMH
- IN2019083V232EY
- IN2019083GVN6PA

(from @jwalgran) The network tab shows a request to the `/api/facilities` endpoint, which we don't need to make in order to render the facility details page.

title: Superuser unable to remove list items from pending lists
body: ### Overview There is a button to remove a facility in the list detail view. This button does not currently work. ### Desired Behavior Required: 1) PENDING LIST - Clicking remove on a facility when a list is in pending status, results in the facility being removed from the list and not geocoded (in the event that list is approved) Nice to have: 2) MESSAGE - Similar to when a list is rejected, there should be a popup when a facility is removed from a pending list. This is free form text box for OS Hub team to message what the issue is. This then triggers an email with OS Hub team's feedback to go to the contributor. ### Additional Context: ![Screen Shot 2022-10-05 at 11.34.20 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/61f9cafd1f9027ce23332739/f17482f1-e27b-40a6-bd66-15fdbb26002b)! ### Technical Implementation The API is returning 404 This is most likely because the `remove_item` view function includes ```python facility_list = FacilityList \ .objects \ .filter(source__contributor=request.user.contributor) \ .get(pk=pk) ``` and this associated except block ```python except FacilityList.DoesNotExist: raise NotFound() ``` Before we updated the workflow to allow the moderation team to handle approve/reject on lists we enforced that only the owner of the list could take action on it - Update `remove_item` to allow superusers to remove items from a list

title: Deleted facilities not really deleting

labels.name: P1
labels.description: site-wide data accuracy, significant usability issue, paid for feature

body:
We are seeing an issue where facilities that have multiple matches (or having many API calls with create=true and match status = pending on the backend) are not completely deleted from the platform and are instead aliased as a different OAR ID (which is created when the original OAR ID is deleted). A user can continue to search for the original OAR ID via the URL and it will be redirected to the newly created OAR ID's URL. 

As an example if you search for this facility via the url IN20220746KTGGV you will notice that it redirects to this facility's page: IN2022250HGNBNT. This will continue to happen (we think) until all of the entries that are in match status = pending on the backend are exhausted. 

E.g. - 
Deleted facility:  IN20220746KTGGV 
Aliased as: IN2022250HGNBNT 

Related to #2019 

## Technical Notes

The delete endpoint currently uses the following logic:
- Delete the FacilityListItem which the Facility was created from, and its linked FacilityMatches
- Look for other automatically matched and confirmed match items associated with the Facility, and if a high-quality alternate match exists, create a new Facility from that match. Move all of the matches and list items to the new Facility.
- Perform various cleanup tasks
- Delete the original Facility

The goal of this behavior is to retain potential high-quality FacilityListItems when deleting a Facility. However, in cases where a single contributor submits a facility dozens or hundreds of times, this results in moderators needing to delete each of those submissions one at a time. 

We would like to adjust the logic of the delete endpoint to the following:
- Delete the FacilityListItem which the Facility was created from, and its linked FacilityMatches
- **Delete any linked FacilityListItems and FacilityMatches linked to the Facility and submitted by the same contributor as submitted FacilityListItem which the Facility was created from.**
- Look for other automatically matched and confirmed match items associated with the Facility **but not submitted by the `created_from` contributor**, and if a high-quality alternate match exists, create a new Facility from that match. Move all of the matches and list items to the new Facility.
- Perform various cleanup tasks
- Delete the original Facility

title: Very long download times

labels.name: P1
labels.description: site-wide data accuracy, significant usability issue, paid for feature

body:
# Bug Description 
Download of all US facilities (using country filter) took 8 min. It's about 9k facilities. 
Download started at :29 and finished at :37. File is attached. 

# Expectation 
It should take no more than ~2 minute to download the entire database. 

We should disable this feature until it is possible to download ~20k records within 30s, full db in 2 min. We risk users trying to do multiple downloads, thinking that the initial download didn't work / froze. Is people try to do multiple downloads, it more cost for us. 

As an interim solution, we are enabling download for up to 10,000 facilities; beyond that the download button is disabled.
 
This info should be displayed via tool tip or popup when a search results in >10k facilities: 
"Downloads are supported only for searches resulting in 10,000 facilities or less." 

# Technical Implementation

- Add a waffle switch called `allow_large_downloads` to conditionally control visibility of the download button on the search results
  - Reworked search results in PR #2110 
- If the the switch is disabled, only show the download button if the total number of matching facilities is < 10,000

title: Allow deletion of facilities with multiple created_from matches
body:
## Overview

When the facility.created_from list item has multiple matches associated with it, we’re only deleting the first match, and the other matches block the facility from being deleted. 

### Expected Behavior

Facilities can be deleted regardless of the number of matches. 

### Actual Behavior

The facility cannot be deleted. The following error is thrown: https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenApparelRegistry/items/1674/

### Steps to Reproduce

* For any facility in local development, create a second FacilityMatch linked to the FacilityListItem which the facility was created from (`Facility.created_from`). 
* Attempt to delete the facility. The facility will fail to delete and an error will be thrown. 

### Demo

After updating the test FacilityDeleteTest as below, the following error was thrown

Updated test:
```diff
diff --git a/src/django/api/tests.py b/src/django/api/tests.py
index fce6560..4e33bff 100644
--- a/src/django/api/tests.py
+++ b/src/django/api/tests.py
@@ -3157,6 +3157,14 @@ class FacilityDeleteTest(APITestCase):
                     confidence=0.85,
                     results='')
 
+        match_4 = FacilityMatch \
+            .objects \
+            .create(status=FacilityMatch.PENDING,
+                    facility=self.facility,
+                    facility_list_item=self.facility.created_from,
+                    confidence=0.85,

         alias = FacilityAlias.objects.create(
             facility=self.facility,

title: Fix processing_type_facility_type_unmatched
body:
## Overview

The warning we set up in the `processing_type_facility_type_unmatched` 
report to let us know about certain invalid values
in the system was triggering all the time, and not just when it should
be, due to an indentation issue.

Connects https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenApparelRegistry/items/1576/?item_page=0&#similar-items

## Testing Instructions

* On `develop`, add a debugger or a print statement at the Rollbar error in `processing_type_facility_type_unmatched()` and ensure you have at least one unmatched processing_type value. Ensure the unmatched value has been added to the system properly.
* Open the processing_type_facility_type_unmatched report and see that the error is triggered incorrectly.
* Repeat the above steps on this branch and see that the error is not triggered. 

## Checklist

- [x] `fixup!` commits have been squashed
- [x] CI passes after rebase
- [x] CHANGELOG.md updated with summary of features or fixes, following [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/) guidelines
- [x] This PR is targeted at the correct branch (`develop` vs. `ogr/develop`)
- [x] If this PR applies to both OAR and OGR a companion PR has been created

title: Pattern in which kinds of files/docs generate errors for blank rows
body:
Sometimes, when users upload a list, the blank rows in their sheet generate errors (Error_Parsing) and sometimes they do not. 

You can see with Ralph Lauren's most recent update, they have 555 errors from blank rows, but the previous version of that list (they said it was the exact same file/formatting), did not generate those errors: https://openapparel.org/dashboard/lists/?contributor=1337

Other examples of lists with lots of errors that appear to be from blank rows:
OVS: https://openapparel.org/dashboard/lists/?contributor=981
Next Plc: https://openapparel.org/dashboard/lists/?contributor=194 - their September 2021 list
Hylo Athletics: https://openapparel.org/dashboard/lists/?contributor=1879 - their December 2021 list

Curious if there's a pattern in why sometimes blank rows are read as errors and sometimes not? It's not a deal-breaker but it's jarring for users to see hundreds of errors in their data.

title: Design a system for excluding non-contributor extended profile values from embedded map search
body:
The first deliverable for this issue is a researched design for how we will implement a fix.

In embedded map, we don’t show the extended fields from other contributors. However, when searching by extended fields, we search on fields submitted by other contributors. So for example, Contributor A and Contributor B both submit Facility X. Contributor A says that Facility X has 2000 workers, but Contributor B says it has 100 workers. On Contributor B’s embedded map you will only see 100 workers listed in the facility details. However, Facility X will still be returned in searches for facilities with over 1000 workers. This could make it look like the search is broken in embedded maps.

The design is located in issue [#1867](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/issues/1867).

title: Information Submitted with Facility Claim not Displaying on Profile

labels.name: high priority
labels.description: Issues and bugs to address first

labels.name: EP_feedback
labels.description: Feedback received about the release of EP

body:
## Overview

A facility claim was made for facility US2022080TK04GQ on staging and a facility description submitted. It is not displaying on the facility profile. 

Where does additional claimed facility data go now? https://staging.openapparel.org/facilities/US2022080TK04GQ (NOTE this link did not work on 4/27/2022)

### Expected Behavior

Submitted information for claimed facility is displayed on facility profile. 

### Actual Behavior

Submitted information does not display. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Claim facility and submit a description 
* view facility profile and observe whether description / other submitted information is there
* this was reproduced in staging 

### Technical Implementation

- The pre-EP facility details page had a section for claim details. Move this content over to the new EP sidebar
- Remove the old sidebar

An exception logged in rollbar originated in FacilityDetailSidebarOriginal and will be resolved by removing FacilityDetailSidebarOriginal.

```
File components/FacilityDetailSidebarOriginal.jsx line 207 col 48 in py.render
const facilityLat = last(data.geometry.coordinates);
```
https://rollbar.com/OpenApparelRegistry/OpenApparelRegistry/items/1599/?utm_campaign=new_item_message&utm_medium=slack&utm_source=rollbar-notification


---

Previously, we included several fields (parent company, number of workers, product types, English-language name, native-language name, address, and production types) under the claimed facility section which we now include in the main facility details section. 

The team discussed on Slack and and agreed the removing text which makes the claimed facilities section clearly separated  and instead add a little ‘claimed’ icon next to any items (like we have for ‘verified’ items) which are from claims anywhere they appear - possibly adding a tooltip to the icon so that same text pops up when the claim icon is hovered over. That way, all of the claim items would be integrated with the regular items but also identifiable.

title: Attribution for EP data not updating when list moved to new contributor profile

labels.name: high priority
labels.description: Issues and bugs to address first

labels.name: EP_feedback
labels.description: Feedback received about the release of EP

body:
## Overview

When a list is moved from one contributor profile to another, the attribution for EP data points is still displaying as from the original contributor, even though the name and address update to the new contributor. 

### Expected Behavior

When a list moves to a different contributor profile, the attribution for all data points on that facility should be updated to the new contributor. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* See this facility for an example: https://openapparel.org/facilities/BD2019241256YMR?contributors=1045&lists=1617
* This was part of a list uploaded by OAR, then moved to ZHDC's profile. 
* The name is attributed to ZDHC (correctly), but the parent company is attributed to OAR. 

### Demo

[Check name data, then check parent company data on this profile](https://openapparel.org/facilities/BD2019241256YMR?contributors=1045&lists=1617)

### Technical implementation

**NOTE** This issue only covers the development of the script needed to fix the data for a list

- Create a SQL or one-line Django shell script (that can be run via ecsmanage) that giving the ID of a list, finds the current contributor associated with that list and corrects the contributor on all of the extended profile fields created from facility list items belonging to that list.

title: Updating the format for downloaded files (CSV, Excel)

labels.name: high priority
labels.description: Issues and bugs to address first

labels.name: EP_feedback
labels.description: Feedback received about the release of EP

body:
## Overview

On download of EP data, we do not see the processed values (e.g. for number of workers or facility type). 

Also confusing is that we see the raw processing and facility type data broken out, even though they are submitted as one - it feels repetitive and confusing. 

### Expected Behavior

Raw uploaded values and processed values are downloadable via excel. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* filter by contributor with EP list [(https://staging.openapparel.org/facilities?contributors=861&lists=803)](https://staging.openapparel.org/facilities?contributors=861&lists=802) 
* download data
* open file to see that processed values are not displayed 

### Demo

For example, you can see that in this download, only the raw values for number of workers is downloading: 
[facilities (3).xlsx](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/8315817/facilities.3.xlsx)

### Technical Implementation
 
Reference this mockup
[Example_DataDownload.xlsx](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/8543524/Example_DataDownload.xlsx)


- Rename facility_type_raw to processing_type_facility_type_raw and drop the duplicate column processing_type_raw
- Order the columns so that column with raw values comes first with processed values to its right; for processing/facility type use: processing_type_facility_type_raw, processing_type, facility_type
-  De-dup facility types when multiple values map to the same facility type within one contributor (this change is illustrated in the attached file where there are 3 processing types uploaded by the same contributor that map to "Final Product Assembly" - we don't need to display "Final Product Assembly" 3x. We do want to display this value again if a different contributor uploaded this.
 - Change CSV/Excel to have multiple rows per facility
	 - One row per contributor
	 - First row shows the same the "top values" from the facility details sidebar
	 - For each contributor, iterate over `extended_fields` to get column values for the corresponding row

title: Claim showing incorrect parent company
body:
## Overview

When viewing a claim, the selected `facility_parent_company` is not shown in the dropdown. Selecting and saving the claim with the correct contributor doesn't fix the problem. 

This appears to be a mixup between Contributor.id and User.id. For example, when saving 'Tai Wilkin' as the parent company (admin user id: 835, contributor id: 830) the value returned for `facility_parent_company` is { id: 835, name: 'Tai Wilkin' } but the displayed value in the selector is jwalgran+2021-03-08@azavea.com (contributor id: 835). 

### Expected Behavior

The dropdown should show the correct value, and whether we are using the contributor or user id for parent company values should be consistent throughout the site. 

### Actual Behavior

The incorrect parent company is shown in the dropdown.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Claim a facility and assign a parent company. Save and refresh the page
* The claim parent company will now show the incorrect value.

### Additional context

The correct parent company shows in the facility details, so these values are being handled differently there vs in the claim.

title: Empty `clean_` fields should not break parsing
body:
## Overview

When there is an error parsing a facility, we attempt to create a list item with an 'ERROR PARSING' status. If this list item has an empty address or name field, it throws an error due to the not-null rule for `clean_name` and `clean_address`. 

### Expected Behavior

The facility list item should be saved successfully with an ERROR_PARSING status.

### Actual Behavior

The error row breaks the processing script. It does seem to process the rest of the items after the row, following further investigation.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Submit a list with empty name and address fields and run `./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action parse`
* There will be an error parsing (correctly), but then a second error will be thrown, breaking the processing script completely

title: Handle the case when exact matching to a non matched items submitted with create=false
body:
### Overview

If facility is submitted via API with `create=false` **and there is no match** a facility list item is created, but there is no facility match or facility. Subsequent submission of the same facility details will be an exact match to the item, but an exception is raised.

In this case, we should ignore the item instead and choose the next exact matching item or, if there are no other exact matches, proceed to the dedupe process.

Ensure that that if there is an automatic dedupe match, `FacilityListItem.facility` is set, allowing subsequent exact matches to avoid the exception. 

```
"Traceback (most recent call last):
  File \"/usr/local/src/api/views.py\", line 1301, in create
    facility = Facility.objects.get(id=facility_id)
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/db/models/manager.py\", line 82, in manager_method
    return getattr(self.get_queryset(), name)(*args, **kwargs)
  File \"/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/db/models/query.py\", line 408, in get
    self.model._meta.object_name
api.models.Facility.DoesNotExist: Facility matching query does not exist.
",
```
         
This is a fix to the original feature was added in #1568 where we implemented to address https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry-clients/issues/61 
  
### Steps to Reproduce

- Browse /api/docs/#!/facilities/facilities_create authorize with an API token
- Submit a facility with `create=false` twice. The second submission should result in `ERROR_MATCHING`
```
{
    "country": "Turkey",
    "name": "BAŞARI TEKSTİL",
    "address": "Merkezefendi"
}
```

body:
## Overview

When navigating away from the map while a marker is present in the map, an error is thrown by something attempting to access the `style` property of an undefined element. 

### Expected Behavior

All map elements should be correctly unmounted when navigating away from the map. No error should be thrown. 

### Actual Behavior

This error only appears in development, most likely because the development debug settings produce an alert while the production settings hide it. If the fullscreen React error message is clicked away, the app behaves as expected.

title: Test breaking due to Google API response change
body:
## Overview

When geocoding a facility, if the country code returned by Google Maps is different from the country code provided by the user, we throw a ValueError.

We’re testing this code with an address that previously was getting mapped by Google Maps to China, and testing that we threw an error because the user had entered it as India. Google is now returning that address as being in India, which means that a value error is (correctly, but breaking the test) not raised. 

We need to update the test to mock the API response so that we are testing only our own code, and not third-party responses.

title: When an additional data point field is empty for a facility, data point should not show up on a facility profile
body:
## Overview

As pictured in this screenshot, a user has uploaded data for a particular data point, but not for all of their facilities. For the facilities that don't have data in this data point, the field still shows up on the facility profile but is blank:

![Screen Shot 2021-11-04 at 10 54 46 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80268596/140336925-0d8578e4-7cca-4daa-87f2-1039eea8e65b.png)

### Expected Behavior

Instead, when a field is empty, that data point should not show up on the facility profile. 

### Actual Behavior

Explanation from Tai:

Looking back at our notes on the issue, we had intended empty fields to be hidden. It looks like the value of the field being returned for that facility is a different form of “empty” than we expected, so it’s not hiding the field correctly.

Essentially, they did “submit” the field for the facility, but it was an empty string (“”) and we’re only checking for null (no value at all). In a list where some facilities have values for a field and some don’t, I think it’s going to come through as an empty string for the rows without the field, since the field/column is technically present for the facility list item. Ideally, we should adjust how we’re checking for empty fields on our end and exclude fields that are empty strings.

cc @katieashaw

title: The other locations section of facility details does not properly anonymize contributor names
body:
## Overview

The `FacilityDetailsSerializer` does not check the permissions of the user in `get_other_locations` and  always serializes the full name of the contributor.

If the user is in the `can_submit_private_facility` group but is not in the `can_view_full_contrib_detail` group (a "hybrid" user) then the contributor names in the `other_locations` section should be anonymized.

title: Embed Config settings not updating on Staging
body:
When trying to update a user's embedded map configuration settings on staging, they are returning a 403 error. 

## Steps to reproduce:

* Login on staging, open the navigation tab in the developer console, and navigate to settings. 
* If you've previously created an embed config, you should see one in the response for https://staging.openapparel.org/user-profile/{id}. Note the id of the config. 
```
color: "#2f658e"
contributor: 830
embed_fields: []
font: "ff-tisa-sans-web-pro,sans-serif"
height: "800"
id: 1
width: "1000"
```
* Go to the embedded map config tab and update any field. You should see a PUT request to https://staging.openapparel.org/api/embed-configs/{id}/ where the id matches the one received in the user-profile information. 
```
color: "#2f658e"
contributor: 830
embed_fields: [{visible: true, order: 0, display_name: "factory_size", column_name: "factory_size"},…]
font: "Arial,sans-serif"
fullWidth: false
height: "800"
id: 1
width: "1000"
```
* You will then get a 403 error (presumably from [here](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/blob/b52ed5ed29f1c7bb6c8c4eaa2e75811a9f171ca2/src/django/api/views.py#L3600)). 
* If you navigate to https://staging.openapparel.org/api/embed-configs/ you will see that the embed_fields for the embed config don't match the ones listed in the user's nonstandard_fields. 

## Additional Context

* One difference between staging and develop is that in develop the user ids match the contributor ids; it's possible there's some kind of mismatch between which id we're using in different places.

title: It's becoming difficult to navigate in Django with so many single facility submissions
body:
## Overview

As users connect with our push pull API and submit multiple single facility queries / contributions, the volume of entries in the Django admin dashboard is growing exponentially. This makes it difficult to quickly search and make changes following user requests.

### Expected Behavior

A more efficient way to search through different sections of Django. 

### Actual Behavior

There are numerous pages in each section of Django, e.g. 54,773 pages of Sources, 537 facility lists (6 pages)

### Additional context

The most frequent user requests we receive which are becoming more cumbersome as the database grows and users make use of our API are:

- Deactivating lists, when users forget to select "replace a list" when uploading an updated list
- Moving facility lists from one Contributor account to another, e.g. when moving data uploaded by the OAR team over to a user, or when one person leaves an organisation and a colleague takes over managing data in the OAR

title: Filtering large numbers of facilities by polygonal area results in high latency
body:
## Overview

When searching for facilities and filtering by polygonal area, queries run slowly enough that they begin to time out. Service and RDS instance CPU usage increases significantly and can cause containers to restart.

### Expected Behavior

Queries should not take long enough to time out or cause large amounts of hanging requests.

### Actual Behavior

Queries that filter by polygonal area have extremely high latency, up to and including timing out.

### Steps to Reproduce

* On staging, run a search that filters based on an area that returns a large number of matches. For example, this query should return over 2000 facilities:

https://staging.openapparel.org/?countries=BD&boundary=%7B%22type%22%3A%22Polygon%22%2C%22coordinates%22%3A%5B%5B%5B88.934326%2C25.055745%5D%2C%5B90.032959%2C22.329752%5D%2C%5B91.428223%2C22.380556%5D%2C%5B92.087402%2C23.211058%5D%2C%5B90.439453%2C24.986058%5D%2C%5B89.428711%2C25.473033%5D%2C%5B88.934326%2C25.055745%5D%5D%5D%7D

This should immediately cause significant latency on Staging. Zoom out 2 - 3 levels and you should begin to see 50x errors.

### Additional context

This results in symptoms similar to #1010. The common factor appears to be filtering by polygonal area in regions that contain a large number of facilities (e.g. Bangladesh).

Here's a a sample query that, when run >50 times, took 4 - 7 seconds to resolve and contributed to application timeouts. This query also filters by country, but the effect is reproducible even without the country filter:

```#sql
CREATE TEMP TABLE hex_grid (
    geom,
    mvt_geom
)
AS (
    SELECT
        geom,
        ST_AsMVTGeom (ST_Centroid (geom), ST_MakeEnvelope (10018754.171394622, 2504688.5428486555, 10331840.239250703, 2817774.6107047363))
    FROM
        generate_hexgrid (39135.758482010104,
            10018754.171394622,
            2504688.5428486555,
            10331840.239250703,
            2817774.6107047363)
);

CREATE INDEX hex_grid_idx ON hex_grid
USING gist (geom);

SELECT
    ST_AsMVT (q,
        'facilitygrid')
FROM (
    SELECT
        hex_grid.mvt_geom,
        count(location),
        ST_XMin (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326))) as xmin,
        ST_YMin (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326))) as ymin,
        ST_XMax (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326))) as xmax,
        ST_YMax (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326))) as ymax
    FROM
        hex_grid
        JOIN api_facility ON ST_Contains (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom,
                4326),
            location)
    WHERE ("api_facility"."country_code" IN ('BD')
        AND ST_Within ("api_facility"."location", ST_GeomFromEWKB ('\x0103000020e6100000010000000500000005508c2c99ab5640d6c6d8092f353640cede196d55595640ed48f59d5fe4354032384a5e9d6b5640f94d61a582ce3840dba2cc0699d85640a1f5f065a2bc384005508c2c99ab5640d6c6d8092f353640'::bytea)))
    AND abs(ST_XMax (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326))) - ST_XMin (ST_Envelope (ST_Transform (hex_grid.geom, 4326)))) < 180
GROUP BY
    hex_grid.mvt_geom,
    xmin,
    ymin,
    xmax,
    ymax) AS q;

```

title: Confirmed/rejected matches do not update PPE fields
body:
## Overview

When a pending match is confirmed or rejected, the PPE data is not copied to the existing or newly created `Facility`.

### Expected Behavior

Confirming or rejecting a match behaves the same as an automatic match. PPE data is copied to the `Facility`.

### Actual Behavior

When a pending match is confirmed, or a new facility is created as the result of rejecting a match, the PPE data is not copied to the `Facility`.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Upload a list that includes pending matches and includes PPE data
* Confirm a pending match
* Reject a pending match

## Overview

### Expected Behavior

When processing a list if one of the values of a `ppe_product_types` array field exceeds the max length of 50 characters the processing job completes successfully and the line is moved to the`ERROR_PARSING` status and shows an informative validation error message.

title: The raw_data field on FacilityListItem is being populated a stringified QueryDict or dict instead of JSON
body: ## Overview The raw_data field on FacilityListItem is being populated with either a QueryDict or a stringified Python dict instead of JSON. Addressing this will require a fix to make sure all incoming data is saved as JSON, and after this fix is deployed, optionally cleaning up the incorrectly serialized legacy data with a migration ### Expected Behavior No matter how data is POSTed to the facility endpoint the body of the request is saved in the `raw_data` field as JSON. ### Actual Behavior The `raw_data` field on `FacilityListItem` is being populated with either a `QueryDict` or a stringified Python dict instead of JSON. ### Steps to Reproduce * POST a valid JSON object to /api/facilities ### Demo

title: Additional work to matcher to reduce the number of potential matches presented to users
body:
## Overview

Following work to improve the algorithm, users are still being presented with a relatively high number of potential matches, e.g. 284 out of list total of 1636. @jwalgran has explained that there is additional work that can be done to the algorithm to further reduce the number of potential matches that users are presented with.

### Expected Behavior

A lower number of potential matches for users to manually confirm / reject. 

### Actual Behavior

Users are still being presented with a relatively high number of potential matches, e.g. 284 out of list total of 1636.

### Additional context

Whilst there will always be the requirement for some manual intervention in the matching process through confirm / reject, we would like to reduce the number of potential matches presented to users.

title: Requests to filter by area and contributor type time out
body:
## Overview

When searching and filtering by polygonal area and contributor type, queries run slowly enough that they begin to time out. Service CPU usage increases significantly and can cause containers to restart, causing downtime.

### Expected Behavior

Queries should not take long enough to time out or cause large amounts of hanging requests.

### Actual Behavior

Queries that filter by area and contributor type have extremely high latency, up to and including timing out.

### Steps to Reproduce

* On staging, run a search that filters based on an area and contributor type that returns a large number of matches. For example:

```
/facilities?contributor_types=Brand%2FRetailer&countries=CN&boundary=%7B%22type%22%3A%22Polygon%22%2C%22coordinates%22%3A%5B%5B%5B107.490234%2C18.895893%5D%2C%5B98.173828%2C33.431441%5D%2C%5B114.873047%2C39.504041%5D%2C%5B124.628906%2C36.244273%5D%2C%5B124.804688%2C27.371767%5D%2C%5B107.490234%2C18.895893%5D%5D%5D%7D
```

### Additional context

This is likely related to #894, but potentially exacerbated by area filtering.

title: Facility API requests are too slow in production after including contributors
body:
## Overview

Some requests for a page of unfiltered facilities take 10 to 20 seconds in production.

### Expected Behavior

Any request for a page of 50 facilites should take less than 2 seconds.

### Actual Behavior

Some requests for a page of unfiltered facilities take 10 to 20 seconds in production.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Browse the home page and "infinite" scroll though the results to trigger requests.

### Additional context

We knew that adding contributor details was expensive, but it was running with acceptable performance in staging. Having 35% more data in production, and possibly more matches within that data could be contributing to the decreased performance.

Some options:

- Add a parameter to the facilities API to conditionally return contributors. We only need them for downloads. Would require a change to the download code to refetch any existing pages.
- Increase the database instance size (unclear if this would have substantial impact on overall performance since we could be running hundreds of individual queries to compile a page of 50 results)
- Build and maintain a search/download index where contributor associations/anonymizations are precomputed.

### Demo

Related to #930

title: Contributors with one or more matched facilities and one error are excluded from the filter dropdown
body:
## Overview

Contributors with one or more matched facilities and one error are excluded from the filter dropdown

### Expected Behavior

If a contributor has 1 or more active matches or new facilities, they appear in the filter dropdown.

### Actual Behavior

If contributor has any list items in an error state they do not appear in the filter dropdown.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Register for a new account and confirm
* Upload [one-bad-one-good.csv.zip](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/4361791/one-bad-one-good.csv.zip) and fully process it
  * ./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action parse
  * ./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action geocode
  * ./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action match
* Browse http://localhost:6543/lists/16 and verify that there is one item in an error state and one successful item
* Browse http://localhost:6543. The newly registered contributor does not appear in the contributors dropdown.

title: Can't select markers on the map after a polygonal search
body:
## Overview

Can't select markers on the map after a polygonal search.

### Expected Behavior

After a polygonal search I can click a marker on the map to select the facility.

### Actual Behavior

Clicking a marker after a polygonal search does nothing.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Browse http://localhost:6543/?boundary=%7B%22type%22%3A%22Polygon%22%2C%22coordinates%22%3A%5B%5B%5B-132.533205%2C53.330873%5D%2C%5B-126.908205%2C11.867351%5D%2C%5B-50.970705%2C12.897489%5D%2C%5B-52.025392%2C55.178868%5D%2C%5B-132.533205%2C53.330873%5D%5D%5D%7D
* Click a map marker

### Additional context

Polygonal search was introduced in #969

Presumably the drawn shape is consuming the click events. If possible, moving that layer below the marker layer may be a quick solution.

title: On the "Potential Matches" page, the Confirm button refreshes the entire page
body:
## Overview

A user had fed back that when working through the Confirm / Reject process, the Confirm button refreshes the entire page, which makes it difficult to do a lot of confirmations.

### Expected Behavior

The page should not refresh when "Confirm" is selected.

### Actual Behavior

Confirm button refreshes the entire page, which makes it difficult to do a lot of confirmations. N.B. This only happens when filtering by "Potential Matches". When scrolling through all facilities on the "My lists" page, the behavior is not seen - see screen records below. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Select a list on staging
* Trial the difference between clicking "Confirm" or "Reject", when filtering my "Potential Matches"

Confirm / Reject when viewing all facilities in the "My lists" section of an account:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/10c6FoqKNxFIIDRWRV7FxRKUer-LPB1vJ/view?usp=sharing

title: Remove case sensitivity on email address for forgot password
body: ## Overview Currently, when a user enters their email address in the forgot password form, we do a case-sensitive search to locate the address. ### Expected Behavior The email address should not be a case sensitive search. ### Actual Behavior The user receives an error message indicating their email address was not found, even if they are registered with that address in the system. ### Steps to Reproduce - Go to https://openapparel.org/auth/login - Click "forgot your password" - Enter an email address with unexpected capitalization in the pop-up box - Receive an error message ### Demo ### Additional context

title: Contributors without any successfully matched or created facilities appear in the Contributor search dropdown
body:
## Overview

A contributor that has submitted a list with items that have all failed parsing appears in the contributor search dropdown.

### Expected Behavior

Contributors who have not submitted and matched or new facilities do not appear in the search dropdown, because they will never have any matching results.

### Actual Behavior

A contributor that has submitted a list with items that have all failed parsing appears in the contributor search dropdown.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Run `./scripts/resetdb`
* Register and confirm a new account with the name "BAD LIST."
* Upload [bad.csv.zip](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/4263292/bad.csv.zip)
* Process the file through the "parse" step `./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action parse`
* Browse http://localhost:6543/lists/16 and verify that there is one item in the `ERROR_PARSING` status
* Browse http://localhost:6543/. "BAD LIST" will appear in the Contributor search dropdown.

title: "adidas" appearing twice as a contributor on a facility
body:
## Overview

adidas is listed twice as a Contributor on facility number VN2019085P645QS.

### Expected Behavior

adidas has uploaded two different lists to the platform, each with different names. Even if this facility appears on both of their lists, should their two contributor entries not show as different names? 

### Actual Behavior

adidas appears twice, simply as "adidas". 

By comparison, if you filter a search of the OAR by Contributor "Wikirate" and then select the first two entries on the scrolling panel, their appearance on the Contributor list shows the different names of their facility lists, rather than just "Wikirate". 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Search VN2019085P645QS
* View the list of Contributors on the profile: adidas appears twice at the bottom.

### Demo

![Screenshot 2019-12-10 at 16 23 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46344729/70548330-42d59b80-1b6a-11ea-8228-8d9ac086190a.png)

Clicking through first entry of "adidas":

![Screenshot 2019-12-10 at 16 23 29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46344729/70548363-51bc4e00-1b6a-11ea-807d-6b80fd643857.png)

Clicking through second entry of "adidas":

![Screenshot 2019-12-10 at 16 23 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46344729/70548383-5a148900-1b6a-11ea-9f7b-bed1c40c8fd8.png)

title: Swagger generated curl examples that include a JSON POST are invalid
body:
## Overview

The automatically generated swagger example for POSTing a new facility returns a 400 error if you copy past and run it in a shell. (In this case bash on macOS 10.14.6)

```
$ curl -X POST --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Authorization: Token abc123...' -d '{ \ 
   "country": "US", \ 
   "name": "Azalea", \ 
   "address": "990 Spring Garden Philadelphia" \ 
 }' 'https://localhost:8081/api/facilities/?create=false'
{"detail":"JSON parse error - Expecting property name enclosed in double quotes: line 1 column 3 (char 2)"}
```

Removing the `\` characters resolves the issue. It appears they are being included in the literal JSON string that is submitted.

```
$ curl -X POST --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --header 'Accept: application/json' --header 'Authorization: Token abc123...' -d '{  
   "country": "US",  
   "name": "Azalea",  
   "address": "990 Spring Garden Philadelphia"  
 }' 'https://localhost:8081/api/facilities/?create=false'
{ ...successful match result... }
```

### Expected Behavior

The example `curl` command can be pasted into a shell and run successfully without modification. 

### Actual Behavior

A 400 error is returned.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Browse https://localhost:8081/api/docs/#!/facilities/facilities_create
* Use the "Authorize" button and submit "Token abc123..."
* Add the JSON below to the `data` field, set `create` to `false` and submit the request.
```js
{
  "country": "US",
  "name": "Azalea",
  "address": "990 Spring Garden Philadelphia"
}
```
* Copy the generated `curl` command, paste it into a shell, and run it.

title: Filtering by contributor or contributor type can result in slow queries that time out
body:
## Overview

Filtering by contributor or contributor type can result in slow queries that time out, which can cause downtime as the slow-to-response services are killed and replaced. 

### Expected Behavior

Filtering by contributor type quickly returns updated results and map tiles.

### Actual Behavior

Queries are slow enough that tile requests can time out where there are thousands of matching results.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Run a search that includes all the contributor types
>/?contributor_types=Auditor&contributor_types=Brand%2FRetailer&contributor_types=Civil%20Society%20Organization&contributor_types=Factory%20%2F%20Facility&contributor_types=Manufacturing%20Group%20%2F%20Supplier%20%2F%20Vendor&contributor_types=Multi%20Stakeholder%20Initiative&contributor_types=Other&contributor_types=Researcher%20%2F%20Academic&contributor_types=Service%20Provider&contributor_types=Union

title: OAR does not currently recognise "People's Republic of China" as a country
body:
## Overview

The OAR does not currently recognise "People's Republic of China" as a country and returns “Status – Error_Parsing”; “Could not find a country code for “People’s Republic of China” message. 

### Expected Behavior

The tool needs to recognise this way of referring to China in user uploads. 

### Actual Behavior

The OAR will not process lists with "People's Republic of China" listed as the country. 

### Steps to Reproduce

* Prepare a list of facilities which have "People's Republic of China" in the country column
* Upload to Staging

N.B. Katie tested this process in Staging today. 

### Demo

![Screenshot 2019-10-11 at 18 14 15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46344729/66670988-f990ca80-ec52-11e9-9a4d-ffacb62a0846.png)

### Additional context

This issue was flagged by a user who had tried to upload a file using this country name.

title: Duplicate other locations are shown
body: ## Overview The other locations section of the facility detail page shows duplicate entries. ### Expected Behavior Each other location is shown once. ### Actual Behavior Other locations can be repeated when multiple matches have the same location. ### Steps to Reproduce As of writing this issue you can see this in production here: https://openapparel.org/facilities/BD2019083JKZJM7 (screenshot below) ### Demo ### Proposed solution - Group the other location records by coordinates - Show each contributor only once under the coordinate - Compensate for rounding errors by using turf to calculate the distance between points and combining the points if they are within a reasonably small minimum distance.

title: Newline and double-quote characters are included in search downloads resulting in invalid CSV files
body:
## Overview

Newline and double-quote characters that appear in facility names and addresses are passed through to CSV downloads, resulting in invalid files.

### Expected Behavior

When downloading search results:
  - Double-quote characters should be escaped as `""` within the quoted name and address fields`.
  - Newline characters should be replaced with single spaces.

### Actual Behavior

Newline and double-quote characters are passed through to the CSV

### Steps to Reproduce

This assumes the database has been reset with `./scripts/resetdb`

* Log in as `c2@example.com`
* Upload  [problem-chars.csv.zip](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/3602479/problem-chars.csv.zip)
* Run `./scripts/dbshell` and execute this query to introduce newline characters
```sql
UPDATE api_facilitylistitem
SET raw_data = replace(raw_data, 'Newline', 'Newline' || chr(10))
WHERE facility_list_id = 16 AND row_index = 0;
```
* Fully process the uploaded list.
  * `./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action parse`
  * `./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action geocode`
  * `./scripts/manage batch_process --list-id 16 --action match`
* Search for the uploaded facilities http://localhost:6543/?q=testing&contributors=2
* Download the CSV containing problem characters.

title: Open pop-ups on map don't clear with a new search
body:
## Overview

A pop-up displayed on the map from a previous search does not clear when a new search is run and there is no way to get rid of the box. 

### Expected Behavior

The pop-up box should either disappear when a new search is run or the X to close the box should always be visible and operational.

### Actual Behavior

The pop-up remains when a new search is run and it is impossible to pan up on the map to close the box. 

### Steps to Reproduce

Tested in Firefox on a Mac but reproduced in other browsers.

1. Search Saitex in the facility name field and view results on the map
2. Click the bubble with a 7 in it
3. Map will zoom in
4. Click the bubble with a 6 in it to get a pop-up
5. Click Reset in the search filters
6. Map resets but popup remains
7. Search toy in the facility name field and select AGT from the contributor list
8. Map loads search results but pop-up remains
9. Attempting to pan up the map to use the X to close the search box just causes the map to bounce back to a view where the top of the box is not visible

### Demo

![Screen Shot 2019-09-10 at 10 00 58 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/516764/64620470-ea97cd80-d3b1-11e9-8da7-9a231fc027b9.png)


### Additional context

Optional. Add any other context about the problem here.

title: The parent company link on the facility claim review page links to the wrong contributor
body:
## Overview

The parent company link on the facility claim review page links to the wrong contributor.

### Expected Behavior

Clicking the parent company link on the facility claim review page navigates to the correct contributor page.

### Actual Behavior

Clicking the parent company link on the facility claim review page navigates to the correct contributor page. The wrong ID is being used to build the link URL.

### Steps to Reproduce

This assumes the fixture data has been loaded

* Use `shell_plus` to create a user account without a related contributor. This ensures the ID sequences between the two model types are out of sync.
```
>>> u = User(email='test@example.com')
>>> u.set_password('testing123')
>>> u.save()
```
* Register and confirm a new account. 
* Log in with that account and open a facility claim. Set the parent company to the newly created contributor associated with the newly registered account
* Log in as `c1@example.com` and browse http://localhost:6543/dashboard/claims
* Open the new claim and verify that the parent company link goes to the wrong page.

### Additional context

We show the link correctly on the facility details page when there is an approved claim.

title: Don't pan map when clicking on a facility marker
body:
## Overview

The map pans when clicking on a visible facility marker. The FacilitiesMap component has logic which was intended to pan the map only when the newly-selected facility is off-screen -- and not when the facility's marker is on-screen -- but the conditional checks in the hook must not have been correct.

### Expected Behavior

Map pans when selecting a facility that is currently NOT within the viewport bbox

Map does NOT pan when selecting a facility that is already within the viewport bbox

### Actual Behavior

Map pans when selecting a facility that is NOT within the bbox

Map ALSO pans when selecting a facility that is within the bbox

title: Users can now upload to the OAR using either CSV or Excel files, but there is only a CSV contributor template
body:
**NOTE:** See the desired changes in the [comment](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/issues/714#issuecomment-547069939) below

## Overview

Users are now able to upload to the OAR using either a CSV file or an Excel file, but there is currently only a Contributor template in CSV format. Some users are encountering issues when converting this to CSV, which is causing upload errors. 

### Expected Behavior

There should be contributor templates in both CSV and Excel formats. 

### Actual Behavior

There is only a Contributor template in CSV format. 

### Steps to Reproduce

Visit the "Contribute" page and download the Contributor template.

title: Information on the "processing" page of the app talks about "accept" or "reject" matches. Options are "confirm" or "reject".
body:
## Overview

On the "Processing" page, which explains how the OAR matching algorithm works, the explanation includes this sentence: 

_If one or more potential matches to an existing facility are found, but the application is not confident enough to make the match automatically, the contributor will be asked to “Accept” or “Reject” the match using buttons within the application._

### Expected Behavior

The options are "Confirm" or "Reject". 

### Actual Behavior

The sentence reads _If one or more potential matches to an existing facility are found, but the application is not confident enough to make the match automatically, the contributor will be asked to “Accept” or “Reject” the match using buttons within the application._

### Steps to Reproduce

Visit: https://openapparel.org/about/processing

title: Add ability for Superusers to download list of contributors from Dashboard
body:
## Overview

There is currently no way for a Superuser to download a list of OAR contributors from the back end of the map

### Expected Behavior

Ability to download a list of OAR contributors should be made possible from the dashboard, and include a date column for when they subscribed / contributed to the platform, and whether or not they opted into the OAR newsletter.

### Actual Behavior

It's currently not possible for Superusers to download a list of contributors from their dashboard.

### Steps to Reproduce

* instructions for reproducing the bug
* prefer bulleted list
* describe the environment: device, os, browser/runtime

### Demo

Optional. Screenshots, gifs, `curl` examples, console errors, log files, etc.

### Additional context

Optional. Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Queryset update calls are bypassing django-simple-history
body:
## Overview

Using `.update()` bypasses django-simple-history tracking.
https://django-simple-history.readthedocs.io/en/2.7.2/common_issues.html#queryset-updates-with-history

Remove all uses of `.update()` with `.save()` inside a loop and ensure the loop is wrapped in a transaction.

title: Facility list items related to deleted facilities are not keyword searchable on the list details page
body:
## Overview

Facility list items related to deleted facilities are not keyword searchable on the list details page

### Actual Behavior

title: Ensure client uses `RouteNotFound` component for all unmatched routes.
body:
## Overview

As described in #560, some react-router `Switch` blocks do not use the `RouteNotFound` component as their default case. As a consequence, some not-declared URLS direct to existing components rather than `RouteNotFound`. For example: `/dashboard/hello/`

We should ensure that the default cases for all react-router `Switch` blocks render the `RouteNotFound` component.

### Desired Behavior

Ensure that the default cases for all react-router `Switch` blocks render the `RouteNotFound` component.

Ensure that all other routes continue to work as before -- and that the API routes also continue to work.

### Additional context

#560 proposes a more complicated system of redirects. However for simplicity's sake we should stick with the default case handling.

Supersedes #560

title: URLs Should Represent Application State
body:
## Overview

Currently, the routing mechanism matches the most it can and ignores the rest. For example, `/dashboard`, `/dashboard/abc`, and `/dashboard/xyz` all route to the same page. This is because `/dashboard` is a real route, and the rest is ignored.

But this is confusing, because the user doesn't know what is being ignored. They may associate the ignored parts of the route with some meaning.

To prevent this, we should have the URLs always represent the present app state. Thus, if a URL has parts of a route that should be ignored, then they should also be discarded. In this way, all three of the above routes would "redirect" to `/dashboard`.

### Expected Behavior

When the user goes to `/dashboard/abc`, the URL should become `/dashboard`.

### Actual Behavior

When the user goes to `/dashboard/abc`, the URL stays the same, but the route of `/dashboard`.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Go to `/dashboard/abc`
* See the URL does not change

### Demo

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1430060/58904113-dbc7bd80-86d4-11e9-863b-7e3cdbc2800e.png)

### Additional context

Original Discussion here: https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/pull/557#issuecomment-498776435

title: Attempting to browse a facility in the Django admin causes a service failure
body: ## Overview On staging, attempting to browse a facility in the Django admin causes the ECS task to fail. ### Expected Behavior An administrator can browse a facility record via the Django admin on staging. ### Actual Behavior The application process fails and staging is offline for a minute or two while a replacement task is started. ### Steps to Reproduce * Log in as an administrative user * Attempt to load a facility detail page in the Django admin ### Additional context Some potentially relevant log activity around the time of a failure. ### In RDS ``` 2019-05-16 17:55:03 UTC:10.0.1.210(50846):openapparelregistry:[23506]:LOG: duration: 2115.492 ms statement: DECLARE "_django_curs_139786784380672_1" NO SCROLL CURSOR WITH HOLD FOR SELECT "api_facilitylistitem"."id", "api_facilitylistitem"."facility_list_id", "api_facilitylistitem"."row_index", "api_facilitylistitem"."raw_data", "api_facilitylistitem"."status", "api_facilitylistitem"."processing_started_at", "api_facilitylistitem"."processing_completed_at", "api_facilitylistitem"."processing_results", "api_facilitylistitem"."name", "api_facilitylistitem"."address", "api_facilitylistitem"."country_code", "api_facilitylistitem"."geocoded_point"::bytea, "api_facilitylistitem"."geocoded_address", "api_facilitylistitem"."facility_id", "api_facilitylistitem"."created_at", "api_facilitylistitem"."updated_at" FROM "api_facilitylistitem" ``` Several of these `FETCH` statements appear ``` 2019-05-16 17:55:18 UTC:10.0.1.210(50846):openapparelregistry:[23506]:STATEMENT: FETCH FORWARD 2000 FROM "_django_curs_139786784380672_1" ``` ### Then In ECS ``` ECS [2019-05-16 17:56:01 +0000] [1] [CRITICAL] WORKER TIMEOUT (pid:9) ``` ### Then Back In RDS ``` 2019-05-16 17:57:25 UTC:10.0.1.210(50898):openapparelregistry:[24431]:LOG: could not receive data from client: Connection reset by peer ```

title: Uploading a CSV file with a UTF-8 BOM returns a confusing header error message
body: ## Overview When attempting to upload certain CSV files the application returns a "Header must contain country, name, and address fields" error but the header in the file appears to be correct. ### Expected Behavior All UTF-8 encoded CSV files with a correct header row can be uploaded. ### Actual Behavior Attempting to upload certain UTF-8 encoded CSV files return an invalid header error. ### Steps to Reproduce * Log in * Browse `/contribute` * Attempt to upload [single-row-csv-with-bom.csv.txt](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/3085763/single-row-csv-with-bom.csv.txt) ### Demo I added a print statement to the code and saw the BOM in the header row ```python ['\ufeffcountry', 'name', 'address'] ``` ### Additional context Python documentation on encodings and reading Unicode https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#encodings-and-unicode https://docs.python.org/3/howto/unicode.html#reading-and-writing-unicode-data Based on the documentation, passing `encoding='utf-8-sig'` to `decode` will likely resolve the issue. We need to make sure that if we use that when reading all files, it will still work.

body:
## Overview

Facilities from an inactive list appear in search by contributor

### Expected Behavior

When searching by contributor, facilities from inactive lists do not appear.

### Actual Behavior

When searching by contributor, facilities from inactive lists do appear.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Register a new account
* Upload 2-row csv [2019-03-26-2-row.csv.txt](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/3009109/2019-03-26-2-row.csv.txt)
* Use `batch_process` to `parse`, `geocode`, and `match` the list.
* Upload 1-row csv and use the "replaces" option to deactivate the 2-row [2019-03-26-1-row.csv.txt](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/3009110/2019-03-26-1-row.csv.txt)
* Use `batch_process` to `parse`, `geocode`, and `match` the list.
* On the map page, search by the new contributor account. 2 facilities appear instead of 1.

title: create_accounts command fails with longer contributor names
body:
## Overview

The `create_accounts` command fails with longer contributor names due to the fact that it is setting `username` (which we do not use in the application) which has a max length of 20.

### Expected Behavior

`create_accounts` succeeds when passed a long name like `"MEC (Material Manufacturers)"`

### Actual Behavior

`create_accounts` raises an DataError when passed a long name like `"MEC (Material Manufacturers)"`

### Steps to Reproduce

* `./scripts/manage create_accounts --type "Brand/Retailer" --password 1234pass --contributors "MEC (Material Manufacturers)"`

title: Large files raise 504 timeout errors when trying to upload them to staging but do not show a helpful error
body:
## Overview

A clear description of the bug.

### Expected Behavior

If there is a 504 timeout, the error message shown says that it took to long to upload the file.

### Actual Behavior

When there is a 504 timeout the error message only says "An error prevented uploading that file"

### Steps to Reproduce

* Log into staging
* Attempt to upload 
[large-test-file-4316.csv.txt](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/2998430/large-test-file-4316.csv.txt)

### Additional context

Ultimately we want to change or optimize the upload process in some way so that we are not susceptible to these timeouts. For the time being, we need a message that explains more clearly the type of failure we encountered.

title: The parse task crashes when a CSV has fields that are too long for the database columns

milestone.title: 2.0 Release
milestone.description: First public release of the Django-backed OAR.

body:
## Overview

When a name, address of a CSV row exceeds the length of the corresponding `FacilityListItem` field the call to `item.save()` causes a crash at the ORM level which kills the entire parse task.

### Expected Behavior

Lines in the CSV that violate the database constraints do not raise unhandled exceptions and a detailed message explaining the failure appears when viewing the list. The list item should be in the `ERROR_PARSING` status.

### Actual Behavior

The entire parse process fails, leaving items in the "UPLOADED" status.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Log in
* Upload [row-2-address-201-characters.csv.txt](https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/files/2998380/row-2-address-201-characters.csv.txt)
* Run the `batch_process` `parse` action. An error will be raised.

title: Welcome pop up on the site needs to be removed
body:
## Overview

The Welcome pop up on the staging site is a hangover from the beta site. The detail on the number of facilities in the tool will be confusing to users of the staging site, as it is now completely wrong (it states that there are over 50,000 facilities in the site).

### Expected Behavior

No pop up should appear on the staging site, for now.

### Actual Behavior

A pop up from the legacy site is still in place on the staging site. It contains information on the number of facilities in the map, which does not continually update as the number changes, so would currently be confusing to users - it says the number of facilities is 50,000, when there are actually only 902 in the site.

The pop up also looks dreadful on mobile - it takes up the entire screen & so you can't close it down to navigate the map. Appreciate the site isn't optimized for mobile or tablet yet, but some people will still initially access the site this way. 

### Steps to Reproduce

- Visit staging.openaparel.org
- Welcome pop up appears in the centre of the map

### Demo

title: Cookie notification does not need to pop up every time you visit the site [SHARES POINT WITH 326]
body:
## Overview

The legally required pop-up re. tracking cookies that has been added to the site appears every single time you visit the site, rather than just the first time you access it. My understanding, and experience through using websites in Europe, is that the pop-up just needs to appear once, be accepted, and then that acceptance applies for all future visits to the site. 

### Expected Behavior

The cookies tracking pop-up should just appear the first time a site is visited. Having accepted that cookies will be tracked, the pop up should not appear again on future visits. 

### Actual Behavior

The pop up appears and has to be accepted every time you visit the OAR site.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Load the home page
* Accept the cookie popup
* Load the home page in a new tab or browser window
