title: Translation only works when logged in and cannot be disabled on the map page

milestone.title: 2.0 Release
milestone.description: First public release of the Django-backed OAR.

body:
## Overview

The app supports translation via a Google Translate script and supporting code loaded on the index page.

https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/blob/0d1003ce1e1168838f865b53d4fa8a28abe47807/src/app/public/index.html#L71-L76

There are two broken behaviors:
- Switching language has no effect unless you are logged in.
- If you log in, browse the map page and choose an alternate language, you cannot revert back to English. The `googtrans` cookie must be deleted to undo the translation.

### Expected Behavior 1

If I browse the map page and I am not logged in, when I choose a non-English language the page is translated into that language.

### Actual Behavior 1

Choosing a non-english language has no effect.

### Steps to Reproduce 1

* Browse http://localhost:6543 when not logged in.
* Choose a non-English language from the "LANGUAGE" menu.

---

### Expected Behavior 2 

When logged in and browsing the map page when I select a non-English language, the page is translated. When I switch back to English, the page is restored.

### Actual Behavior 2

When logged in and browsing the map page when I select a non-English language, the page is translated. When I switch back to English, the page briefly appears in English then reverts back to the previously selected language.

### Steps to Reproduce 2

* Browse http://localhost:6543 
* Log in
* Choose a non-English language from the "LANGUAGE" menu.
* Choose English from the the "LANGUAGE" menu.

title: Facilities List is Incorrectly Cached
body:
## Overview

If, after logging out from an account A, I login as a second account B, go to my Lists and click My Facilities, I am shown the facilities contributed by A, not by B.

### Expected Behavior

When My Facilities is clicked, the facilities contributed by the currently active account are shown.

### Actual Behavior

Facilities cached from last time are shown.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Have two accounts, A and B.
* Log in as A. Go to My Lists, then My Facilities. Note the URL and the contributor filter value.
* Log out. Log in as B. Go to My Lists, then My Facilities. Note the URL and the contributor filter correspond to A, instead of B.

### Demo

![2019-03-07 17 46 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1430060/53994889-7ed26080-4101-11e9-8968-407c1d95f3d3.gif)

Note the URL and the value in the filter.

### Additional context

The link from My Facilities is correct, but the change happens somewhere during routing. Thus, if the link for A is `/facilities/?contributor=100` and the list for B is `/facilities/?contributor=101`. The My Facilities link for B will point to `101`, and then navigate to `101`, but then somehow everything will shift to `100` and the URL will be updated to match.

* Submit the password reset and browse the link printed to the server console
* Attempt to reset the password to "a" or "password".

body:

We'll need to conditionally have the app delay trying to load styles until the map is loaded, but also make sure that once the styles are loaded the data loads and is turned into markers without any additional interaction.

App does not crash

### Actual Behavior

App crashes when it tries to manipulate the map before styles have loaded

title: Mapbox API Key Not Set
body:
## Overview

Mapbox API key is not being set on the map, because it is using the new style environment injection introduced in https://github.com/open-apparel-registry/open-apparel-registry/commit/e9b95288a34566410ddfa53e9b122d9e89c31d16. Compile time variable replacement only works when the entire string is specified using dot notation, e.g. `process.env.REACT_APP_MAPBOX_TOKEN`, not via the indirection being used now.

For unclear reasons, this has not caused a crash on staging.

### Expected Behavior

Mapbox API key is set.

### Actual Behavior

Mapbox API key is not set.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Open the developer tools and look under Debugger / Sources, and isolate the missing variable

### Additional context

See here for more on build-time environment variables for Create React App: https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/adding-custom-environment-variables.

We may have to adopt fundamentally different strategies for compile time and run time variables.

title: Add babel polyfill for IE11

milestone.description: First public release of the Django-backed OAR.

body:
## Overview

The client code is currently missing polyfills for IE11, which means it won't work there:

![screen shot 2019-02-06 at 1 29 12 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4165523/52364481-51679980-2a13-11e9-9b25-31a77f11534e.png)

Add the required polyfill so the site works in IE11+

### Expected Behavior

Site should load in IE11

### Actual Behavior

Site fails to load because of some ES6/7 syntax IE11 can't parse.

### Additional context

We typically add the polyfill in our webpack configuration file, but since this is set up in CRA we will have to figure out an alternate way to handle it.
